column4: does anyone have any idea why this server isn't getting outside access when static ip is assigned?
did you define a default route and gw?
did you define dns servers in /etc/resolv.conf?
can you ping the gateway address?
then there is a problem getting through the gateway
that doesn't look right. .254 is the broadcast address for the network. The gateway is the hub address, which is usually .1
and your static ip should be something 'normal' I usually start my static IPs at 150 or 200.
you need to make sure you don't use a static ip that the hub might reassign as dynamic to someone else.
that is the way I have it configured and have no problems with any other machine
you have broadcast and gateway the same?
my dhcp has certain ip's blocked out for static assignment that is one of them
well, if that works it is magic I never saw before
